page.title: 08Clubs
page.content: Simon says that the grown-ups have many things to do in Wolvey. "My dad is on the committee of Wolvey Cricket{CLUB.}They have their ground and pavilion in the village{PLAYING {FIELDS}run by the Wolvey Playing Fields Association." Mrs. Holt tells us about the{WOMEN'S {INSTITUTE}in Wolvey."It started on 7th April 1943 with 132 members. Five of the original members still belong. The membership is now 42 and they meet in the Village Hall once a month." The{BOWLING CLUB}has Mrs. Patterson on the committee and she says "It is not crown green but flat green bowling.We have an active membership and we play many local clubs as well as some further afield."
